alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Tippecanoe; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 12:07AM EST until January 30 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Covington...down to Riverton. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River at Lafayette. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash from a combination of precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall on partially frozen ground. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Lafayette. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lowland flooding is in progress. Flood waters near SR 225 between Old SR 25 and Battleground. Warren CR 350 N near Black Rock Preserve and Tippecanoe CR 950 W in the Wabash Bottoms, Janssen Tract area may be impassable. Fort Ouiatenon grounds begin to flood. Flooding at the Grandville Public Access site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 PM EST Thursday was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.4 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon.this afternoon by around 100 PM EST /noon CST/.
